disobedience.question: Did you intentionally become sterilized, thereby rejecting God's plan for your reproductive gifts?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately altering one's fertility represents an act of defiance against God and implies we know better than divine wisdom, placing our desires for control above trust in God's plan for our lives.

disobedience.question: Have I used words to scornfully belittle the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Have I engaged in activities on Sundays when they could have been avoided, thereby showing disrespect for the day of rest?
disobedience.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

condoning.question: Did I, in any capacity, condone a funeral where human remains were not properly buried?
